channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Zero-Day in December 2025 Patch Tuesday
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Zero-Day in December 2025 Patch Tuesday

Summary:
Microsoft's final Patch Tuesday of 2025 addressed 57 vulnerabilities, including two zero-day flaws. The most critical, CVE-2025-62221, is a privilege escalation vulnerability in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver that is confirmed to be under active exploitation. The flaw allows a local attacker to gain SYSTEM-level privileges. Due to its active use in attacks, CISA has added it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating federal agencies to patch by December 30, 2025. A second, publicly disclosed zero-day, CVE-2025-54100, an RCE in PowerShell, was also patched but is not known to be exploited.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's December 2025 Patch Tuesday addresses 57 vulnerabilities, including the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2025-62221, a privilege escalation flaw in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-zero-day-cve-2025-62221-december-2025

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Patches Eighth Chrome Zero-Day of 2025 Under Active Attack
item.description:
Headline: Google Patches Eighth Chrome Zero-Day of 2025 Under Active Attack

Summary:
Google has released an emergency, out-of-band security update for its Chrome browser, patching its eighth zero-day vulnerability of 2025. The high-severity flaw, tracked as issue 466192044, is confirmed to be actively exploited in the wild. To prevent further abuse, Google has withheld technical details but analysis suggests it may be a buffer overflow in the ANGLE graphics library. All 3.4 billion Chrome users are urged to update their browsers immediately to version 143.0.7499.109 or later.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Google has released an emergency security update for Chrome to fix a high-severity zero-day vulnerability (issue 466192044) that is being actively exploited in the wild.

Article Slug: google-patches-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-december-2025

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Conduent Breach Exposes 10.5M Patients, Ranks as 8th Largest US Healthcare Breach
item.description:
Headline: Conduent Breach Exposes 10.5M Patients, Ranks as 8th Largest US Healthcare Breach

Summary:
Business services giant Conduent has disclosed a massive data breach that exposed the personal and medical information of over 10.5 million people, making it the 8th largest healthcare data breach in U.S. history. The breach, which was active for months between October 2024 and January 2025, has already cost the company $25 million in response efforts. The compromised data includes names, Social Security numbers, and health information, leading to multiple class-action lawsuits against the company.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Incident Response

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Business services provider Conduent has disclosed a massive data breach affecting 10.5 million individuals, exposing sensitive personal and medical information and leading to multiple class-action lawsuits.

Article Slug: conduent-data-breach-impacts-10-million-in-major-healthcare-incident

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Hamas-Affiliated "Ashen Lepus" APT Deploys New "AshTag" Malware in Middle East Espionage Campaign
item.description:
Headline: Hamas-Affiliated "Ashen Lepus" APT Deploys New "AshTag" Malware in Middle East Espionage Campaign

Summary:
A Hamas-affiliated advanced persistent threat (APT) group, tracked as Ashen Lepus and WIRTE, is conducting a multi-year espionage campaign against government and diplomatic entities in the Middle East. According to research from Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42, the group has expanded its targeting to Oman and Morocco and is deploying a previously undocumented custom malware suite named "AshTag." The campaign's primary goal is intelligence collection, and it has remained active through recent regional conflicts and ceasefires.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Hamas-affiliated APT group Ashen Lepus (also known as WIRTE) is conducting a long-running espionage campaign against government and diplomatic entities in the Middle East using a new malware suite called AshTag.

Article Slug: hamas-affiliated-apt-ashen-lepus-targets-middle-east-with-ashtag-malware

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New DoS and Source Code Exposure Flaws Found in React Server Components
item.description:
Headline: New DoS and Source Code Exposure Flaws Found in React Server Components

Summary:
Just one week after patching the critical "React2Shell" RCE vulnerability, the React core team has disclosed new flaws in React Server Components. Discovered by researchers analyzing the initial fix, the new issues include a high-severity Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability (CVE-2025-55184, CVE-2025-67779) and a medium-severity source code exposure flaw (CVE-2025-55183). Developers using affected versions are urged to update their packages immediately, as systems patched for React2Shell are still vulnerable to these new attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The React core team has disclosed new vulnerabilities in React Server Components, including a high-severity Denial-of-Service (DoS) and a medium-severity source code exposure flaw, requiring an immediate update.

Article Slug: react-server-components-vulnerable-to-dos-and-source-code-exposure

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "Battering RAM": $50 Hardware Attack Cracks Intel and AMD Secure CPU Enclaves
item.description:
Headline: "Battering RAM": $50 Hardware Attack Cracks Intel and AMD Secure CPU Enclaves

Summary:
At the Black Hat Europe 2025 conference, researchers from KU Leuven University demonstrated "Battering RAM," a novel hardware attack that completely undermines modern confidential computing technologies. Using a custom-built DDR4 interposer costing just $50, the attack can bypass the memory encryption of secure enclaves like Intel SGX and AMD SEV. This allows an attacker with physical access to read encrypted memory at runtime, extract secret keys, and defeat protections previously thought to be secure against physical threats.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers have developed 'Battering RAM,' a low-cost ($50) hardware attack using a DDR4 interposer to defeat confidential computing technologies like Intel SGX and AMD SEV, enabling plaintext memory access.

Article Slug: battering-ram-hardware-attack-defeats-intel-sgx-amd-sev

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Warns of "Shai-Hulud 2.0" Worm Stealing Cloud Credentials via npm
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Warns of "Shai-Hulud 2.0" Worm Stealing Cloud Credentials via npm

Summary:
Microsoft has issued a critical alert about "Shai-Hulud 2.0," a highly aggressive, self-replicating worm conducting a major supply chain attack. The malware targets developers by compromising npm packages and uses a malicious `pre-install` script to activate before installation. It steals a wide range of cloud service and developer credentials (AWS, Azure, GCP) and exfiltrates them to public GitHub repositories, enabling rapid and widespread compromise. Microsoft is urging all organizations to act quickly to rotate potentially exposed credentials.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft warns of a significant supply chain attack by the 'Shai-Hulud 2.0' worm, which compromises npm packages to steal and exfiltrate developer and cloud service credentials to public GitHub repositories.

Article Slug: microsoft-warns-of-shai-hulud-2-0-supply-chain-worm-on-github

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New "DroidLock" Android Ransomware Locks Devices, Streams from Camera
item.description:
Headline: New "DroidLock" Android Ransomware Locks Devices, Streams from Camera

Summary:
A new Android ransomware strain, dubbed "DroidLock," is spreading via phishing websites and using deceptive tactics to gain powerful device permissions. Researchers at Zimperium report that the malware tricks users into granting it Accessibility Service permissions, which it then abuses to perform a "total takeover" of the device. DroidLock locks the screen, threatens to permanently destroy all files within 24 hours if a ransom isn't paid, and includes an invasive feature that streams live video from the phone's front-facing camera to its operators.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Mobile Security, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A new Android ransomware strain called 'DroidLock' spreads via phishing, abuses Accessibility Service permissions to lock devices, and threatens to destroy files within 24 hours while also streaming from the camera.

Article Slug: new-droidlock-android-ransomware-issues-24-hour-ultimatum

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: TriZetto Discloses Year-Long Data Breach Exposing Patient PHI
item.description:
Headline: TriZetto Discloses Year-Long Data Breach Exposing Patient PHI

Summary:
TriZetto Provider Solutions, a healthcare revenue management company owned by Cognizant, has started notifying clients about a major data breach. An unauthorized party had access to patient data for nearly a full year, from November 2024 until the breach was detected on October 2, 2025. The attackers accessed historical reports containing sensitive Protected Health Information (PHI), including patient names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, and health insurance details. The cybersecurity firm Mandiant was brought in to investigate the long-running intrusion.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: TriZetto Provider Solutions, owned by Cognizant, has disclosed a data breach where an unauthorized party had access to patient protected health information (PHI) for nearly a year before being detected.

Article Slug: trizetto-discloses-year-long-data-breach-exposing-patient-phi

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Goes Global, Targeting New Regions and Industries with Weaker Defenses
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Goes Global, Targeting New Regions and Industries with Weaker Defenses

Summary:
Ransomware is becoming a more globalized and unpredictable threat, according to the H2 2025 Global Threat Briefing from cyber analytics firm CyberCube. The report warns that ransomware groups are actively expanding into new geographic regions and industry sectors that have historically seen fewer attacks, often targeting those with less mature cyber defenses. The highly active LockBit ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group is a key driver of this trend. The findings suggest that traditional risk models based on geography or industry are becoming less reliable predictors of attack likelihood.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new report from CyberCube reveals that ransomware is becoming a more globalized threat, expanding into new regions and industries with less mature cyber defenses, with groups like LockBit leading the charge.

Article Slug: ransomware-expands-to-new-regions-and-industries-report-finds

Published Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 12 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Zero-Day in Final 2025 Update
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Zero-Day in Final 2025 Update

Summary:
Microsoft's December 2025 Patch Tuesday release addresses 57 vulnerabilities, including a critical, actively exploited zero-day privilege escalation flaw in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver. Tracked as CVE-2025-62221, the vulnerability allows a local attacker to gain SYSTEM-level privileges and has been added to CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The update also patches two other publicly disclosed vulnerabilities in GitHub Copilot and Windows PowerShell, alongside critical RCE flaws in Microsoft Office.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Microsoft's December 2025 Patch Tuesday addresses 57 vulnerabilities, including the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2025-62221 in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver, which CISA has added to its KEV list.

Article Slug: microsoft-december-2025-patch-tuesday-exploited-zero-day-cve-2025-62221

item.title: NEW: New "DroidLock" Android Malware Hijacks Devices, Steals Credentials
item.description:
Headline: New "DroidLock" Android Malware Hijacks Devices, Steals Credentials

Summary:
A sophisticated new Android malware strain, named DroidLock, is actively targeting users in Spain through phishing websites. The malware tricks users into granting extensive permissions, including Accessibility Services and device administrator rights. Once active, DroidLock can lock the device, display fake update screens, steal credentials using overlay attacks, capture screen activity, and access the device's camera, representing a significant threat to mobile users.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A new Android malware strain named DroidLock is targeting users in Spain, using phishing and Accessibility Service abuse to gain full control of devices, lock them, and steal credentials.

Article Slug: droidlock-android-malware-gains-full-device-control-via-phishing

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: NATO Sharpens Cyber Defenses in Massive "Cyber Coalition" War Game
item.description:
Headline: NATO Sharpens Cyber Defenses in Massive "Cyber Coalition" War Game

Summary:
NATO has successfully concluded its largest annual cyber defense exercise, "Cyber Coalition," in Tallinn, Estonia. The week-long event involved approximately 1,500 military and civilian personnel from 29 NATO members and seven partner nations. Participants collaborated to defend a fictional nation's critical infrastructure against a series of realistic, hybrid cyberattacks, enhancing their collective ability to respond to modern threats.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: NATO's annual 'Cyber Coalition' exercise brought together 1,500 military personnel from 36 countries in Estonia to test and enhance coordinated cyber defense capabilities against simulated hybrid attacks.

Article Slug: nato-tests-cyber-defenses-in-large-scale-cyber-coalition-exercise

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical Infrastructure at Risk Due to "Deficient" OT Cybersecurity Training
item.description:
Headline: Critical Infrastructure at Risk Due to "Deficient" OT Cybersecurity Training

Summary:
A new report from Australian cybersecurity firm Secolve has exposed significant deficiencies in operational technology (OT) cybersecurity training across critical infrastructure sectors. The survey of senior professionals in industries like energy, manufacturing, and water found that training is often generic, infrequent, or completely ignored. This lack of specialized training is creating a dangerously immature security culture and leaving vital industrial environments unprepared for cyberattacks.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Security Operations

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: A new report from Secolve reveals severe deficiencies in operational technology (OT) cybersecurity training across critical infrastructure sectors, finding it often infrequent, too IT-focused, or ignored.

Article Slug: report-reveals-critical-lack-of-ot-cybersecurity-training

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Hackers Use Animated Lures and Fake Legal Warnings to Spread Malware
item.description:
Headline: Hackers Use Animated Lures and Fake Legal Warnings to Spread Malware

Summary:
HP's latest Threat Insights Report reveals a significant evolution in social engineering tactics, with cybercriminals using highly convincing lures such as professional animations and fake legal warnings to trick users into downloading malware. The report highlights a campaign impersonating the Colombian Prosecutor's Office to deliver PureRAT. It also details the abuse of trusted platforms like Discord for hosting malicious payloads like the Phantom Stealer and notes the rising threat of session cookie hijacking.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: HP's latest Threat Insights Report reveals cybercriminals are using sophisticated social engineering, like professional animations and fake legal warnings, to distribute malware such as PureRAT and Phantom Stealer.

Article Slug: hp-report-cybercriminals-using-sophisticated-social-engineering-lures

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Hamas-Linked APT "Ashen Lepus" Targets Middle East with New "AshTag" Malware
item.description:
Headline: Hamas-Linked APT "Ashen Lepus" Targets Middle East with New "AshTag" Malware

Summary:
The Hamas-affiliated advanced persistent threat (APT) group known as Ashen Lepus (or WIRTE) is conducting an ongoing espionage campaign targeting governmental and diplomatic entities in the Middle East. Researchers have identified a new, modular .NET malware suite named AshTag being used in these attacks. The campaign marks a significant evolution in the group's sophistication, incorporating enhanced encryption, in-memory payload execution, and the use of legitimate-looking subdomains to evade detection.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Hamas-affiliated APT group Ashen Lepus (WIRTE) is targeting diplomatic and government entities in the Middle East with a new modular .NET malware suite called AshTag, showing an evolution in tactics.

Article Slug: hamas-affiliated-apt-ashen-lepus-deploys-new-ashtag-malware

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "Operation DupeHike" Espionage Campaign Targets Russian Corporate HR Depts
item.description:
Headline: "Operation DupeHike" Espionage Campaign Targets Russian Corporate HR Depts

Summary:
A highly targeted cyber-espionage campaign, dubbed "Operation DupeHike," has been identified targeting employees in Russian corporations. Attributed to the threat actor cluster UNG0902, the campaign uses convincing social engineering lures, such as decoy documents about employee bonuses, to infiltrate networks. The primary targets are staff in HR, payroll, and administrative departments, with the goal of achieving persistent surveillance and exfiltrating sensitive corporate data.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DupeHike,' attributed to threat actor UNG0902, is targeting employees in Russian corporations using realistic decoy documents to infiltrate networks.

Article Slug: operation-dupehike-cyber-espionage-campaign-targets-russian-companies

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Unpatched Zero-Day in Gogs Git Service Actively Exploited to Gain SSH Access
item.description:
Headline: Unpatched Zero-Day in Gogs Git Service Actively Exploited to Gain SSH Access

Summary:
A critical, unpatched zero-day vulnerability in Gogs, a popular self-hosted Git service, is being actively exploited in the wild. Tracked as CVE-2025-8110 with a CVSS score of 8.7, the flaw is a bypass of a previously patched RCE and allows an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files, ultimately leading to SSH access on the server. Researchers at Wiz have identified over 700 compromised instances, with attackers deploying the Supershell C2 framework.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A high-severity unpatched zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-8110) in the Gogs self-hosted Git service is being actively exploited, allowing attackers to gain SSH access to servers.

Article Slug: unpatched-gogs-git-service-zero-day-cve-2025-8110-actively-exploited

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New Flaws in React Server Components Expose Apps to DoS, Source Code Leaks
item.description:
Headline: New Flaws in React Server Components Expose Apps to DoS, Source Code Leaks

Summary:
Following last week's critical "React2Shell" vulnerability, the React team has disclosed two additional vulnerabilities affecting React Server Components. The new flaws include a high-severity Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability (CVE-2025-55184, CVE-2025-67779) and a medium-severity Source Code Exposure vulnerability (CVE-2025-55183). Developers who recently patched for React2Shell are urged to update their dependencies again immediately to protect against these new threats.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Following the 'React2Shell' vulnerability, researchers have found two new flaws in React Server Components: a high-severity Denial of Service (CVE-2025-55184) and a source code exposure bug (CVE-2025-55183).

Article Slug: new-dos-and-source-code-exposure-vulnerabilities-found-in-react

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Fake Leonardo DiCaprio Movie Torrent Used as Bait to Spread Agent Tesla Trojan
item.description:
Headline: Fake Leonardo DiCaprio Movie Torrent Used as Bait to Spread Agent Tesla Trojan

Summary:
Cybercriminals are luring victims with a fake torrent for a new Leonardo DiCaprio movie to distribute the Agent Tesla information-stealing trojan. Security researchers at Bitdefender analyzed the campaign, revealing a complex, multi-stage attack chain that uses a malicious .lnk shortcut, hidden batch commands in subtitle files, and multiple layers of PowerShell to execute the final payload. The malware runs only in memory and establishes persistence through a fake audio diagnostic task, making it highly evasive.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Security researchers at Bitdefender discovered a fake movie torrent being used to infect Windows users with the Agent Tesla trojan through a complex, multi-stage attack chain.

Article Slug: fake-movie-torrent-spreads-agent-tesla-malware

Published Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 11 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: React2Shell: Critical 10.0 CVSS RCE Flaw in React and Next.js Under Active Exploitation
item.description:
Headline: React2Shell: Critical 10.0 CVSS RCE Flaw in React and Next.js Under Active Exploitation

Summary:
A critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, dubbed 'React2Shell' (CVE-2025-55182), has been disclosed in React Server Components, affecting popular frameworks like Next.js. With a maximum CVSS score of 10.0, the flaw allows attackers to compromise servers with a single crafted HTTP request, requiring no user interaction. The vulnerability stems from an unsafe deserialization process in the 'Flight' protocol. Following the public disclosure on December 3, 2025, multiple weaponized proofs-of-concept became available, and active exploitation attempts by threat actors, including China-nexus groups, were observed. CISA has added CVE-2025-55182 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating immediate patching for federal agencies and urging all organizations to update affected components.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A critical 10.0 CVSS RCE vulnerability, CVE-2025-55182 (React2Shell), affects React Server Components and Next.js. Learn about the active exploitation, affected versions, and immediate patching instructions.

Article Slug: critical-react2shell-rce-vulnerability-in-react-and-nextjs-sparks-emergency-patching

Published Date: Thu, 04 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 04 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT
